column1: Common Bond Bistro & Bakery - Montrose////Yes Common Bond is pricey
column2: but absolutely worth it. The quality is evident
column3: from the breads to the desserts and the meals. I mostly been here for brunch
column4: which has always been a great experience. Coming with a friend or two
column5: I like getting the $5 daily bread selection which comes with an assortment of the day's bread with a flavored house butter and jam or marmalade. Paired with a buttery/crispy/flaky croissant or some other pastry and coffee and you have perfection. I would also recommend their yogurt parfait
column6: the jam pairs perfectly with the rich yogurt and crunchy granola. Although I can't speak for the lunch menu
column7: I definitely would like to try it later on--they looked promising with fusion dishes.
